title: (x) Identuty crisis? font looks like Times new Roman but is not? - Stone Serif, Times Italic, ITC Garamond {Craig E, Florian}
content:
Hello,

Can anyone help me with this identity crisis?

I have a font looking a lot like Times new Roman, however there seems to be a slight difference.

Can anyone tell me what font i am dealing with here?

I have uploaded an attachment. Please advise....

Thanks for the help...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102336im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Scan_Pic0004_6204.jpg)
author: obrowne

comments.content:
The smaller bold line looks like [ITC Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102336/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_garamond_std_bold/?&sample_text=Het%20bijgaande%20wordt%20u%20zonder%20begeleidend&sample_size=18&update=0).  
The italic is Times (i.e. not Times _New Roman_ – there are a few minor differences: ‘A’ more upright, ‘e’ and ‘a’ narrower, ‘g’ ear shorter …)
I think eliason is right here.

Eliasson, Florian and XO,

Thanks a lot.

turned out to be a combination of  
- Stone Serif Semi for Ritsema on the dot!  
- Times italic for: Administratie & Adviesburo (italic) also correct.
